channel.title: Webclient Maker
channel.description:
How cool would it be if you just zipp'ed your client folder and you ran a webclient maker and it made you a client.jar and cache.zip?
/discuss

item.title: Webclient Maker
item.dc:creator: @gravenfire23 gravenfire23
item.description:
@gravenfire23 wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:6, topic:406699”]While we’re at it, lets make a program that downloads the the most updated PI (or w/e the fuck is being used now) server, changes a few things, makes them owner, and uploads it to a vps for them. That way everyone can sit around scratching their balls hoping to god their server/client doesn’t crash forcing them to go beg for help on sites because they don’t know a damn thing about how any of it works.[/quote]Good idea, ill go get to work.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient Maker
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

While we’re at it, lets make a program that downloads the the most updated PI (or w/e the fuck is being used now) server, changes a few things, makes them owner, and uploads it to a vps for them. That way everyone can sit around scratching their balls hoping to god their server/client doesn’t crash forcing them to go beg for help on sites because they don’t know a damn thing about how any of it works.

item.title: Webclient Maker
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“runewings317, post:3, topic:406699”][quote author=Squirt Ltd link=topic=503698.msg3685239#msg3685239 date=1311801180]
it would be easy for leeching fucks who dont know anything about java except changing some npc coords and names

but seriously, making a webclient isnt hard at all
[/quote]Changing NPC coords isn’t java xD[/quote]
That was his point…

Read full topic
